body:
We don't current support Web Worker features, it's not in the Fetch Spec yet, but a Web Worker feature.

https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#headers-class
These methods are not in the fetch spec, but in Web IDL's [Iterable declarations](http://heycam.github.io/webidl/#es-iterable), and iterable is defined in fetch's Headers class.

@zbinlin you are right, I wonder where I find the web worker reference, probably a line from MDN.

Anyway I think `iterable` is not in many Node.js environment yet (require ES6 Symbol and iterator support), can we do this without taking on too much complexity or dependency?

@bitinn, the for-of syntax and `@@iterator` are indeed ES2015 features, but `entries()`, `values()`, and `keys()` functions can be implemented using ES5 just fine. To do so, the easy way can just be returning an object with `{next, done}`. If we want higher level of standard compliance we should use a prototype-based approach like [es6-iterator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/es6-iterator).

issue.title: "TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined" when calling headers.getAll()

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

body:
It really sucks that we have to support older Node environment cuz some people never update.
I would never bother if someone wrote this in the top of all the readme's

```
Require node version 6.2+
```

I would gladly go update my node env

I wanted to contribute first but [wasn't allowed to use es6](https://github.com/bitinn/node-fetch/issues/97). So now I'm only subscribed to this repo to help others with some issues whenever I feel like helping. 

Otherwise I would have done something like this long time ago

``` javascript
class Headers extends Map {}
```

Map's comes with many methods Header-class are supposed to have.

btw: http://node.green/#Map

I am open to a more spec compliant **node-fetch 2.0**, even if it means breaking a few things, like older Node environment. **1.x branch** is good enough at this point I am quite confident developers can find ways to achieve their goals (sometimes a bit dirty or ugly, but that's software development).

The loudest complains we heard are ES6 features and Isomorphism related, so I do feel we may move onto that path eventually. It will be quite an undertaking to bring in the remaining client-side features, and I will admit I don't have enough free time to tackle this problem at the moment.

_Spec compliant_ also means:
- removing our UTF-8 conversion and encoding support (`text()` is UTF only).
- encourage web-stream instead of node-stream.

If you interested in such a thing, give me a shout at #8 or #73 

(Plus if people want a fully ES6-compliant module, I am probably not the right guy to drive it, as I am a bit old-fashioned in that I don't fully subscribe to the _tranpile, not polyfill_ belief just yet.)

issue.title: Convert Headers to ES2015 and implement Iterable interface

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

issue.body:
Closes #127, #174.

The approach taken by this pull request versus #174 is that the iterator methods are greatly simplified as well as more correct w.r.t. the behavior of `keys()` in case of multiple values.
